qas.question: According to the Anglo-Saxon chronicle, who reestablished London in 886 AD?
Danelaw, established by the Vikings, covered what  geographical area?
What was the name of the Danish warlord who played a major role in establishing Danelaw?
Following the Viking invasion, when did London begin to significantly grow and expand?

answers.text: political and geographical control imposed by the Viking incursions

context: The Vikings established Danelaw over much of the eastern and northern part of England with its boundary roughly stretching from <a1_0>London to Chester<a1_0/>. It was an area of <a4_0>political and geographical control imposed by the Viking incursions<a4_0/> which was formally agreed to by the Danish warlord, <a2_0>Guthrum<a2_0/> and west-Saxon king, Alfred the Great in 886 AD. The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle recorded that London was "refounded" by <a0_0>Alfred the Great<a0_0/> in 886. Archaeological research shows that this involved abandonment of Lundenwic and a revival of life and trade within the old Roman walls. London then grew slowly until <a3_0>about 950<a3_0/>, after which activity increased dramatically.
